ai.question: Why is IEEE 802.11 wireless technology able to transmit further distances than Bluetooth technology?

choice.text: transmits at much lower frequencies
has higher power output
transmits at much higher frequencies
uses better encryption methods

ai.question: What are three advantages of wireless over wired LAN technology? (Choose three.)

choice.text: lower on-going costs
longer transmission distance
ease of installation
easily expandable
higher level of security
cheaper host adapters

ai.question: In which scenario would wireless security be most important?

choice.text: Your wireless mouse uses the IrDA port on your desktop PC.
The local coffee shop provides free Internet access as a wireless hot spot.
A real estate agent sends information on the sale of a house through a cell phone.
Two users create a wireless peer-to-peer network in order to share a music file.

ai.question: Which wireless technology standard provides the most compatibility with older wireless standards, but has greater performance?

form-item.ai: allows long range point-to-point connections between networksacts as a media converterparticipates as a host device in a wireless networkconnects two wired networks through a wireless linkcontrols access between a wired and wireless networkreferred to as a STA Wireless ClientAccess PointWireless Bridge Drag the characteristic on the left to the WLAN component on the right.123456no titleno description given3625141client=host device, STA; AP=media converter, access between wired and wireless network; Bridge=two wired networks through a wireless link, long range connections

an AP controls who talks and whentwo or more wireless clients in a peer-to-peer networkindividual STAs do not communicate directly with each otherusually a less expensive networklarger networks require this type of installationdoes not include an AP Ad-hocInfrastructure Mode Drag the characteristic on the left to the installation type on the right.123456no titleno description given2461351Ad-hoc=peer to peer, no AP, less expensive; Infrastructure=AP controls, STAs not communicate directly, larger networks require

ai.question: What is CSMA/CA on a network?

choice.text: an access method used by wireless technology to avoid duplicate SSIDs
an access method used by any technology that has excessive collisions
an access method used by wired Ethernet technology to avoid collisions
an access method used by wireless technology to avoid collisions

ai.question: What statement is true about authentication using pre-shared keys when EAP is enabled?

choice.text: uses a key to encrypt a random string of bytes sent by the AP
requires a backend authentication server such as RADIUS
performs one-way authentication only
allows clients to associate based on MAC addres

ai.question: When is a client considered to be "authenticated" when only MAC address filtering is enabled on the access point?

choice.text: when the client gives the access point the correct secret key
when the client sends the MAC address to the access point
when the access point verifies that the MAC address is in the MAC table and sends a confirmation message to the client
when the access point sends the MAC address to the server and receives notification that the MAC address is a valid one
